Jekyll

Installing Jekyll

On Mac

Additional instructions can be found at 

We’ll start by opening up the Terminal which can be found by clicking on the magnifine glass and typing Terminal. In the Terminal we can run the rest of our installation commands. First step type the following in to the terminal and press enter.

xcode-select --install

This should make a pop-up asking if you want to install comand line developer tools. Click on the install button.

OS X already has Ruby already installed but it has some quirks that makes installing Jekyll tricky. Instead of using this version, we’ll install our own version of Ruby:

First we’ll install Homebrew. Homebrew helps you install packages and is a must-have for anyone programming on OS X. To do this type the following in to the terminal and press enter.

/usr/bin/ruby -e "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/master/install)"

Now we need to install a second instance(fancy word for a second copy) of ruby. So once again type the following in to terminal and press enter.

brew install ruby

and finally jekyll. So once again type the following in to the terminal and press enter.

gem install --user-install bundler jekyll

To check that it’s all worked, and avoid problems in the future we’ll then just double check everything is in the correct directory

ruby -v

This will tell you which version of Ruby you are using. Then append your path file with the following, replacing the X.X with the first two digits of your Ruby version.

export PATH=$HOME/.gem/ruby/X.X.0/bin:$PATH

To check your that you gem paths point to your home directory run:

gem env

On a Windows PC

Step 1- Ruby

Go to https://rubyinstaller.org/downloads/ and download

  • ruby v 2.3.3 (64-bit if you are running a 64 bit computer otherwise the blank one(you can tell if you are 64 by checking for a program files(64))).
  • ruby dev kit (32bit if you got 32bit and 64bit if you got the 64 bit)

Double click on the ruby to install it. Make sure to tick the add ruby executables to your path (otherwise you will need to reinstall).

Next we need to install dev kit. Start by extracting the devkit to a new folder(i suggest C:/ruby-temp). then open up cmd (command prompt) and then navigate to the folder(inside of cmd type in cd c:/ruby-temp and press enter).

Next type in the following code and press enter.

ruby dk.rb init

Then you need to type in

ruby dk.rb install

Now we need to go to https://rubygems.org/pages/download/ to download the ruby gems zip.

Just like before we need to unzip it in to a new folder (c:/gems) and navigate there(inside of cmd type in cd c:/gems and press enter). then still in terminal just type in

ruby setup.rb

and you are done with ruby.

Step 2 - Installing Jekyll

Type in the following code to cmd.

gem install jekyll

Wait while jekyll is installed. It will look like nothing is happening, but jekyll is installing. Eventually it will say a number of gems have been installed, then its all installed.
